cache_responses.who is faruk?: Faruk Hasan is a Senior QA Automation Engineer (SDET) and STEM Educator who teaches Python, AI, Web Development, and Robotics to students around the world. He combines 5+ years of professional QA experience with a strong passion for teaching, curriculum design, and building practical AI tools. Faruk is known for creating hands-on courses and innovative automation projects using Playwright, Python, and SQLite.
cache_responses.what courses do you teach?:
I teach a variety of hands-on STEM courses for ages 9–18:
- Python Programming (Beginner to Advanced)
- Python + Algebra Year-Long Course
- AI Coding & Chatbot Development
- Web Development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React)
- Arduino & Electronics
- Computer Fundamentals (OS, CLI, hardware basics)
- Robotics with Python
- VR App Development
I also build custom tech courses and curriculum for schools and organizations.
cache_responses.what is your education?: I hold a **B.Eng in Electrical Engineering** from Queen Mary University of London and a **Master’s degree** from Loyola Marymount University in Los Angeles.
cache_responses.how many students have you taught?: I’ve taught more than **1,894 students** across my online platforms with an average rating of **4.82/5 stars** from parents and learners.
cache_responses.do you have a udemy course?: Yes. I recently launched **'Python Fundamentals: Fun and Practical Projects for Beginners'** on Udemy. I am also creating new courses on AI, Robotics, and Web Development.
cache_responses.what are your technical skills?:
I specialize in building QA automation frameworks and AI-assisted testing tools.

**Core Tech Skills:**
- **Languages:** Python, JavaScript, SQL
- **Automation:** Playwright, Selenium, Pytest
- **DevOps:** GitHub Actions, CI/CD, Docker
- **AI:** RAG systems, LLM-based test analysis, chatbot development
- **Web Dev:** HTML, CSS, JS, React
I design modern, scalable, test automation frameworks and build educational and productivity tools.
cache_responses.tell me about your background: I was born in Bangladesh and grew up across several countries because of my father's airline career. I've lived in London, Los Angeles, and now New York, where I work remotely as a Senior SDET while teaching STEM globally. My diverse path—from teaching math to developing automation frameworks—shapes the way I teach and build technology today.
cache_responses.what is your career journey?: After completing my studies in London and Los Angeles, I worked in various fields including education and gig work before entering tech in 2020. I quickly advanced from QA Engineer to Senior SDET, specializing in automation frameworks, AI-driven testing, and CI/CD pipelines. Alongside my industry work, I built a thriving teaching career, designing project-based courses for young learners and creating real-world technical tools such as Chrome extensions, dashboards, SQLite-based test systems, and AI agents.
